name: Trillium HomeCare
overview:
By founding Trillium HomeCare, Robert and Carolyn Dickinson have improved the lives of Michigan residents who are in need of in-home assistance. Since Trillium HomeCare opened its doors in 2003, the agency has been committed to providing non-medical services of the highest standard.

The Dickinsons bring their own medical backgrounds to their work at Trillium. Mr. Dickinson served in the U.S. Army Reserve for six years as a combat medic, while Ms. Dickinson is a registered nurse. Together with a small staff, they operate their in-home care agency from Farmington Hills, Michigan.

Trillium HomeCare offers unique resources to clients and their families. The agency’s fully trained and insured employees all have been screened for drug and tobacco use. These experienced caregivers are available on an as-needed basis for visits ranging from three hours to full-time hours. Additionally, clients are under no obligation, as there are no long-term contracts.

Families can be certain that their loved ones are safe, as Trillium HomeCare has staff who are available by phone around the clock. The agency also offers a personal emergency reporting system to its clients for just $1 per day.
